Description: A healthier take on the classic, featuring panko-crusted chicken breasts baked until crispy, then topped with marinara and cheese for a guilt-free indulgence.
Ingredients: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 5 oz each). ½ cup whole wheat flour. 2 large eggs, beaten. 1 cup whole wheat panko breadcrumbs. ¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese, divided. 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning. ½ teaspoon garlic powder. Salt and black pepper to taste. 2 tablespoons olive oil spray or 1 tablespoon olive oil. 2 cups low-sodium marinara sauce. 6 oz part-skim mozzarella cheese, sliced. Fresh parsley for garnish.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spray lightly with olive oil. Pound chicken breasts to ½-inch thickness. 2. Set up a breading station: one shallow dish with whole wheat flour, one with beaten eggs, and one with panko breadcrumbs mixed with 2 tablespoons Parmesan, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. 3. Dredge each chicken cutlet in flour, then dip in egg, then coat thoroughly with panko mixture. 4. Place breaded chicken on the prepared baking sheet. Lightly spray the tops of the chicken with olive oil spray (or brush with 1 tbsp olive oil). 5. Bake for 15 minutes, flip, and bake for another 5-7 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through. 6. Remove from oven. Spoon ½ cup marinara sauce onto the baking sheet around the chicken. Top each chicken cutlet with remaining marinara, mozzarella slices, and remaining 2 tablespoons Parmesan cheese. 7. Return to oven and bake for another 5-7 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly. 8. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.

Description: Mini chicken Parmesan sandwiches, perfect for parties or a fun meal, featuring crispy chicken, marinara, and melted cheese on soft slider buns.
Ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken tenders (about 8-10 pieces). ½ cup all-purpose flour. 1 large egg, beaten. 1 cup plain breadcrumbs. ¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese. 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning. Salt and black pepper to taste. 3 tablespoons olive oil. 1 cup marinara sauce. 8 slices provolone cheese (or mozzarella). 8 slider buns, split. Fresh basil for garnish.
Instructions: 1. Pound chicken tenders lightly to even thickness. 2. Set up a breading station: one shallow dish with flour, one with beaten egg, and one with breadcrumbs mixed with Parmesan, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. 3. Dredge each chicken tender in flour, then dip in egg, then coat thoroughly with breadcrumb mixture. 4. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry chicken tenders for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown and cooked through. Drain on paper towels. 5. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Open slider buns and place the bottom halves on a baking sheet. 6. Place a cooked chicken tender on each bun bottom. Top with a spoonful of marinara sauce and a slice of provolone cheese. 7. Place the top halves of the buns on top. Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until cheese is melted and buns are lightly toasted. 8. Garnish with fresh basil and serve immediately.

Description: A comforting casserole combining tender chicken Parmesan cutlets with pasta, rich marinara, and a generous layer of melted cheese, baked to golden perfection.
Ingredients: 1 lb penne pasta. 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 5 oz each). ½ cup all-purpose flour. 2 large eggs, beaten. 1 cup plain breadcrumbs. ¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese, divided. 1 teaspoon garlic powder. ½ teaspoon dried basil. Salt and black pepper to taste. 3 tablespoons olive oil, divided. 4 cups marinara sauce. 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese. ½ cup shredded provolone cheese. Fresh parsley for garnish.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cook penne pasta according to package directions until al dente. Drain and set aside. 2. Pound chicken breasts to ½-inch thickness. 3. Set up a breading station: one shallow dish with flour, one with beaten eggs, and one with breadcrumbs mixed with 2 tablespoons Parmesan, garlic powder, dried basil, salt, and pepper. 4. Dredge each chicken cutlet in flour, then dip in egg, then coat thoroughly with breadcrumb mixture. 5. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sear chicken for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown. Remove chicken and set aside. 6. In a large baking dish, combine cooked pasta with 3 cups marinara sauce. Stir well. 7. Arrange seared chicken cutlets over the pasta. Spoon remaining 1 cup marinara sauce over the chicken. 8. Top with shredded mozzarella, provolone, and remaining 2 tablespoons Parmesan cheese. 9. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until bubbly and cheese is golden brown. 10. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot.

Description: Crispy, golden chicken bites cooked in the air fryer, then tossed with marinara and cheese for a quick and easy, flavorful snack or light meal.
Ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into 1-inch cubes. ½ cup all-purpose flour. 1 large egg, beaten. 1 cup plain breadcrumbs. ¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese. 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning. Salt and black pepper to taste. Olive oil spray. ½ cup marinara sauce, warmed. ¼ cup shredded mozzarella cheese. 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped.
Instructions: 1. Pat chicken cubes dry. 2. Set up a breading station: one shallow dish with flour, one with beaten egg, and one with breadcrumbs mixed with Parmesan, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. 3. Dredge each chicken cube in flour, then dip in egg, then coat thoroughly with breadcrumb mixture. 4. Preheat air fryer to 375°F (190°C). Lightly spray the air fryer basket with olive oil spray. 5. Place breaded chicken bites in a single layer in the air fryer basket, ensuring not to overcrowd. Lightly spray the tops of the chicken with olive oil spray. 6. Air fry for 10-12 minutes, shaking the basket halfway through, until golden brown and cooked through. Work in batches if necessary. 7. In a bowl, toss the cooked chicken bites with warm marinara sauce. 8. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and air fry for another 1-2 minutes, or until cheese is melted. 9. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve immediately.

Description: A comforting and hearty Italian classic featuring layers of rich meat sauce, creamy béchamel, tender pasta, and melted mozzarella.
Ingredients: 1 lb ground beef. 1 large onion, chopped. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 28 oz can crushed tomatoes. 6 oz can tomato paste. ½ cup water. 2 tsp dried oregano. 1 tsp dried basil. Salt and pepper to taste. 12 lasagna noodles, oven-ready or pre-boiled. 15 oz ricotta cheese. 1 large egg. ½ cup grated Parmesan cheese. 1 tsp fresh parsley, chopped. 4 cups shredded mozzarella cheese. For Béchamel Sauce: 4 tbsp unsalted butter. 4 tbsp all-purpose flour. 3 cups whole milk, warm. Pinch of nutmeg. Salt and white pepper to taste.
Instructions: 1. For the meat sauce: Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat. Drain fat. Add onion and garlic, cook until softened. Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, water, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. 2. For the béchamel: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually whisk in warm milk until smooth. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened. Season with nutmeg, salt, and white pepper. 3. For the ricotta mixture: In a bowl, combine ricotta cheese, egg, Parmesan cheese, and parsley. Season with salt and pepper. 4. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. 5. Assemble lasagna: Spread a thin layer of meat sauce on the bottom of the baking dish. Place 3-4 lasagna noodles over the sauce. Spread half of the ricotta mixture over the noodles. Top with a layer of meat sauce, then a layer of béchamel sauce, and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Repeat layers: noodles, remaining ricotta, meat sauce, béchamel, mozzarella. Add a final layer of noodles, top with remaining meat sauce, béchamel, and a generous amount of mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. 6. Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake for another 20-25 minutes, or until bubbly and cheese is golden brown. Let stand for 10-15 minutes before serving.

Description: A flavorful and wholesome lasagna packed with layers of roasted seasonal vegetables, creamy ricotta, rich marinara, and tender pasta.
Ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil. 1 medium zucchini, sliced. 1 medium yellow squash, sliced. 1 red bell pepper, sliced. 1 green bell pepper, sliced. 1 medium onion, sliced. 1 eggplant, sliced. Salt and pepper to taste. 24 oz jar marinara sauce. 12 lasagna noodles, oven-ready. 15 oz ricotta cheese. 1 large egg. ½ cup grated Parmesan cheese. 2 tbsp fresh basil, chopped. 4 cups shredded mozzarella cheese.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Toss zucchini, yellow squash, bell peppers, onion, and eggplant with olive oil, salt, and pepper on a baking sheet. Roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender and slightly caramelized. 2. In a bowl, combine ricotta cheese, egg, Parmesan cheese, and chopped basil. Season with salt and pepper. 3. Reduce oven temperature to 375°F (190°C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. 4. Assemble lasagna: Spread a thin layer of marinara sauce on the bottom of the baking dish. Place 3-4 lasagna noodles over the sauce. Spread half of the ricotta mixture over the noodles. Top with half of the roasted vegetables, then a layer of marinara sauce, and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Repeat layers: noodles, remaining ricotta, remaining roasted vegetables, marinara sauce, mozzarella. Add a final layer of noodles, top with remaining marinara sauce, and a generous amount of mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. 5. Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake for another 20-25 minutes, or until bubbly and cheese is golden brown. Let stand for 10-15 minutes before serving.

Description: A rich and indulgent lasagna featuring layers of tender shredded chicken, creamy homemade Alfredo sauce, tender pasta, and a blend of Italian cheeses.
Ingredients: 2 cups cooked chicken, shredded. 12 lasagna noodles, oven-ready. 15 oz ricotta cheese. 1 large egg. ½ cup grated Parmesan cheese. 2 tbsp fresh parsley, chopped. 4 cups shredded mozzarella cheese. For Alfredo Sauce: 1 stick (½ cup) unsalted butter. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 2 cups heavy cream. 1 ½ cups grated Parmesan cheese. Salt and black pepper to taste. Pinch of nutmeg.
Instructions: 1. For the Alfredo sauce: Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant. Pour in heavy cream and bring to a gentle simmer. Reduce heat to low. Gradually whisk in Parmesan cheese until melted and smooth. Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Keep warm. 2. In a bowl, combine ricotta cheese, egg, ½ cup Parmesan cheese, and chopped parsley. Season with salt and pepper. 3. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. 4. Assemble lasagna: Spread a thin layer of Alfredo sauce on the bottom of the baking dish. Place 3-4 lasagna noodles over the sauce. Spread half of the ricotta mixture over the noodles. Top with half of the shredded chicken, then a layer of Alfredo sauce, and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Repeat layers: noodles, remaining ricotta, remaining chicken, Alfredo sauce, mozzarella. Add a final layer of noodles, top with remaining Alfredo sauce, and a generous amount of mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. 5. Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake for another 20-25 minutes, or until bubbly and cheese is golden brown. Let stand for 10-15 minutes before serving.

Description: A classic vegetarian lasagna featuring layers of tender pasta, a creamy blend of ricotta and spinach, rich marinara sauce, and melted mozzarella.
Ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil. 1 large onion, chopped. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 28 oz can crushed tomatoes. 6 oz can tomato paste. ½ cup water. 2 tsp dried oregano. 1 tsp dried basil. Salt and pepper to taste. 12 lasagna noodles, oven-ready. 15 oz ricotta cheese. 1 large egg. ½ cup grated Parmesan cheese. 10 oz frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry. 4 cups shredded mozzarella cheese.
Instructions: 1. For the marinara sauce: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, water, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. 2. For the ricotta-spinach mixture: In a bowl, combine ricotta cheese, egg, Parmesan cheese, and squeezed dry spinach. Season with salt and pepper. 3. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. 4. Assemble lasagna: Spread a thin layer of marinara sauce on the bottom of the baking dish. Place 3-4 lasagna noodles over the sauce. Spread half of the ricotta-spinach mixture over the noodles. Top with a layer of marinara sauce, and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Repeat layers: noodles, remaining ricotta-spinach mixture, marinara sauce, mozzarella. Add a final layer of noodles, top with remaining marinara sauce, and a generous amount of mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. 5. Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake for another 20-25 minutes, or until bubbly and cheese is golden brown. Let stand for 10-15 minutes before serving.

Description: A fun and flavorful twist on lasagna, layered with seasoned ground beef, corn tortillas, black beans, corn, salsa, and plenty of melted cheese.
Ingredients: 1 lb ground beef. 1 large onion, chopped. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 packet (1 oz) taco seasoning. 15 oz can black beans, rinsed and drained. 15 oz can corn, drained. 16 oz jar salsa. 12 corn tortillas, cut in half. 4 cups shredded Mexican blend cheese. ½ cup sour cream (for topping, optional). Fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish, optional).
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. 2. In a large skillet, brown ground beef over medium heat. Drain fat. Add onion and garlic, cook until softened. Stir in taco seasoning according to package directions. Add black beans, corn, and half of the salsa. Simmer for 5-7 minutes. 3. Assemble lasagna: Spread a thin layer of the beef mixture on the bottom of the baking dish. Arrange a layer of corn tortilla halves over the beef mixture. Spread a thin layer of the remaining salsa over the tortillas. Sprinkle with a generous amount of Mexican blend cheese. Repeat layers: beef mixture, tortillas, salsa, cheese. Finish with a final layer of tortillas, top with remaining beef mixture, and a generous amount of cheese. 4. Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake for another 15-20 minutes, or until bubbly and cheese is golden brown. Let stand for 10-15 minutes before serving. Garnish with sour cream and fresh cilantro if desired.

Description: The authentic Roman pasta dish featuring crispy guanciale, rich egg yolks, Pecorino Romano cheese, and freshly ground black pepper.
Ingredients: 200g spaghetti or bucatini. 150g guanciale, cut into lardons. 2 large egg yolks. 1 whole large egg. 50g Pecorino Romano cheese, finely grated. Freshly ground black pepper to taste. Salt for pasta water.
Instructions: 1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil. Add the spaghetti and cook according to package directions until al dente. 2. While the pasta cooks, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the guanciale and cook until crispy and golden, rendering out most of its fat. Remove the crispy guanciale with a slotted spoon and set aside. Keep the rendered fat in the skillet. 3. In a medium bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, whole egg, grated Pecorino Romano, and a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper until smooth. 4. Before draining the pasta, reserve about 1 cup of the starchy pasta water. Drain the pasta and immediately add it to the skillet with the guanciale fat. Toss to coat. 5. Remove the skillet from the heat. Quickly pour the egg and cheese mixture over the hot pasta, tossing continuously and vigorously with tongs. Add a splash of reserved pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce that coats the pasta. The residual heat from the pasta will cook the eggs without scrambling them. 6. Stir in most of the crispy guanciale. Serve immediately, garnished with the remaining crispy guanciale, extra Pecorino Romano, and more black pepper.

Description: A slightly milder take on the classic, using pancetta for a savory base and adding sweet peas for a touch of freshness and color.
Ingredients: 200g spaghetti. 150g pancetta, diced. 2 large egg yolks. 1 whole large egg. 50g Pecorino Romano cheese, grated. 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped. 1/2 cup frozen peas. Freshly ground black pepper. Salt for pasta water.
Instructions: 1. Cook spaghetti in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente. 2. While pasta cooks, render the diced pancetta in a large skillet over medium heat until crispy. Remove pancetta, leaving fat in the pan. 3. In a bowl, whisk egg yolks, whole egg, Pecorino Romano, and black pepper. 4. Add frozen peas to the skillet with pancetta fat and cook for 2-3 minutes until heated through. 5. Reserve 1 cup pasta water. Drain spaghetti and add to the skillet with peas and pancetta fat. Toss well. 6. Remove skillet from heat. Pour egg mixture over pasta, tossing quickly and continuously. Add reserved pasta water gradually to create a creamy sauce. 7. Stir in crispy pancetta and chopped parsley. Serve immediately.

Description: A hearty and satisfying carbonara featuring tender chicken breast and earthy mushrooms, perfect for a more substantial meal.
Ingredients: 200g fettuccine. 200g boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces. 150g cremini mushrooms, sliced. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 2 large egg yolks. 1 whole large egg. 50g Parmesan cheese, grated. 2 cloves garlic, minced. Freshly ground black pepper. Salt for pasta water and chicken.
Instructions: 1. Cook fettuccine in salted boiling water until al dente. 2. Season chicken pieces with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside. 3. Add sliced mushrooms to the same skillet and cook until softened and browned, about 5-7 minutes. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more until fragrant. 4. In a bowl, whisk egg yolks, whole egg, grated Parmesan, and black pepper. 5. Reserve 1 cup pasta water. Drain fettuccine and add to the skillet with mushrooms and garlic. Add cooked chicken back to the skillet. 6. Remove skillet from heat. Pour egg mixture over pasta and chicken, tossing vigorously. Add reserved pasta water gradually to achieve a creamy sauce. Serve immediately.

Description: A rich and savory vegetarian carbonara, using a generous amount of mushrooms to provide an umami depth that mimics the traditional cured meats.
Ingredients: 200g spaghetti. 300g mixed mushrooms (cremini, shiitake, oyster), sliced. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 2 large egg yolks. 1 whole large egg. 60g Pecorino Romano cheese, grated. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped. Freshly ground black pepper. Salt for pasta water and mushrooms.
Instructions: 1. Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente. 2. While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add sliced mushrooms and cook until deeply browned and tender, about 8-10 minutes. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more until fragrant. Season mushrooms with salt and pepper. 3. In a bowl, whisk egg yolks, whole egg, grated Pecorino Romano, and a generous amount of black pepper. 4. Reserve 1 cup pasta water. Drain spaghetti and add to the skillet with the cooked mushrooms. 5. Remove skillet from heat. Pour egg mixture over pasta, tossing quickly and continuously. Add reserved pasta water gradually to create a creamy sauce. 6. Stir in chopped fresh parsley. Serve immediately, garnished with extra cheese and black pepper.

Description: A sophisticated and flavorful twist on carbonara, combining the richness of the egg sauce with delicate smoked salmon and fresh dill.
Ingredients: 200g linguine. 150g smoked salmon, cut into strips. 2 large egg yolks. 1 whole large egg. 50g Parmesan cheese, grated. 2 tablespoons fresh dill, chopped. 1 tablespoon olive oil. Freshly ground black pepper. Salt for pasta water.
Instructions: 1. Cook linguine in salted boiling water until al dente. 2. While pasta cooks, gently warm olive oil in a large skillet over low heat. If desired, briefly warm the smoked salmon strips in the oil for about 30 seconds, then remove and set aside. (Alternatively, add salmon raw at the end). 3. In a bowl, whisk egg yolks, whole egg, grated Parmesan, and black pepper. 4. Reserve 1 cup pasta water. Drain linguine and add to the skillet (if using) or a large mixing bowl. 5. Remove from heat. Pour egg mixture over pasta, tossing quickly and continuously. Add reserved pasta water gradually to create a creamy sauce. 6. Gently fold in the smoked salmon strips and chopped fresh dill. Serve immediately.

Description: A timeless Italian pizza featuring a simple yet delicious combination of tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, and basil.
Ingredients: Pizza dough (store-bought or homemade) 300g. 1/2 cup crushed San Marzano tomatoes. 150g fresh mozzarella, torn. 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves. 1 tablespoon olive oil. Salt to taste.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F) with a pizza stone or baking steel if available. 2. On a lightly floured surface, stretch or roll out the pizza dough to your desired thickness. 3. Transfer the dough to a piece of parchment paper or a lightly floured pizza peel. 4. Spread the crushed tomatoes evenly over the dough, leaving a small border for the crust. 5. Distribute the torn fresh mozzarella over the sauce. 6. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with a pinch of salt. 7. Carefully transfer the pizza to the preheated oven. 8. Bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly and slightly browned. 9. Remove from oven, scatter fresh basil leaves over the top, slice, and serve immediately.

Description: A beloved pizza featuring savory pepperoni slices, rich tomato sauce, and melted mozzarella cheese on a crispy crust.
Ingredients: Pizza dough (store-bought or homemade) 300g. 1/2 cup tomato pizza sauce. 200g shredded mozzarella cheese. 70g sliced pepperoni. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F) with a pizza stone or baking steel if available. 2. On a lightly floured surface, stretch or roll out the pizza dough to your desired thickness. 3. Transfer the dough to a piece of parchment paper or a lightly floured pizza peel. 4. Spread the tomato pizza sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a small border for the crust. 5. Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce. 6. Arrange the pepperoni slices evenly over the cheese. 7. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with dried oregano. 8. Carefully transfer the pizza to the preheated oven. 9. Bake for 12-18 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly and the pepperoni is slightly crispy. 10. Remove from oven, slice, and serve immediately.

Description: A colorful and healthy pizza loaded with a variety of fresh vegetables, tangy tomato sauce, and melted mozzarella cheese.
Ingredients: Pizza dough (store-bought or homemade) 300g. 1/2 cup tomato pizza sauce. 150g shredded mozzarella cheese. 1/2 red bell pepper, sliced. 1/2 green bell pepper, sliced. 1/4 red onion, thinly sliced. 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms. 1/4 cup black olives, sliced. 1 tablespoon olive oil. 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F) with a pizza stone or baking steel if available. 2. On a lightly floured surface, stretch or roll out the pizza dough to your desired thickness. 3. Transfer the dough to a piece of parchment paper or a lightly floured pizza peel. 4. Spread the tomato pizza sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a small border for the crust. 5. Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce. 6. Arrange the sliced red bell pepper, green bell pepper, red onion, mushrooms, and black olives evenly over the cheese. 7. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with Italian seasoning. 8. Carefully transfer the pizza to the preheated oven. 9. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly and the vegetables are tender-crisp. 10. Remove from oven, slice, and serve immediately.

Description: A flavorful pizza topped with tender shredded chicken tossed in sweet and smoky BBQ sauce, red onion, cilantro, and melted mozzarella cheese.
Ingredients: Pizza dough (store-bought or homemade) 300g. 1/2 cup BBQ sauce. 1 cup cooked chicken breast, shredded. 150g shredded mozzarella cheese. 1/4 red onion, thinly sliced. 2 tablespoons fresh cilantro, chopped. 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F) with a pizza stone or baking steel if available. 2. On a lightly floured surface, stretch or roll out the pizza dough to your desired thickness. 3. Transfer the dough to a piece of parchment paper or a lightly floured pizza peel. 4. In a bowl, toss the shredded cooked chicken with 1/4 cup of the BBQ sauce. 5. Spread the remaining 1/4 cup BBQ sauce evenly over the pizza dough, leaving a small border for the crust. 6. Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce. 7. Distribute the BBQ chicken mixture and thinly sliced red onion evenly over the cheese. 8. Drizzle with olive oil. 9. Carefully transfer the pizza to the preheated oven. 10. Bake for 12-18 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly. 11. Remove from oven, sprinkle with fresh cilantro, slice, and serve immediately.

Description: A rich and creamy pizza featuring a decadent blend of mozzarella, provolone, parmesan, and gorgonzola cheeses, with no tomato sauce.
Ingredients: Pizza dough (store-bought or homemade) 300g. 100g shredded mozzarella cheese. 50g shredded provolone cheese. 30g grated Parmesan cheese. 20g crumbled Gorgonzola cheese. 2 tablespoons olive oil. 1/2 teaspoon black pepper.
Instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F) with a pizza stone or baking steel if available. 2. On a lightly floured surface, stretch or roll out the pizza dough to your desired thickness. 3. Transfer the dough to a piece of parchment paper or a lightly floured pizza peel. 4. Drizzle 1 tablespoon of olive oil evenly over the dough, leaving a small border for the crust. 5. Evenly distribute the mozzarella, provolone, Parmesan, and Gorgonzola cheeses over the dough. 6. Drizzle with the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil and sprinkle with black pepper. 7. Carefully transfer the pizza to the preheated oven. 8. Bake for 12-18 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheeses are bubbly and melted. 9. Remove from oven, slice, and serve immediately.

Description: A classic, quick, and healthy stir-fry featuring tender chicken and crisp broccoli in a savory ginger-garlic sauce, perfect for a weeknight meal.
Ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into 1-inch pieces. 4 cups broccoli florets. 1 red bell pepper, sliced. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 inch fresh ginger, grated. 2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce. 1 tablespoon oyster sauce (optional). 1 tablespoon rice vinegar. 1 teaspoon sesame oil. 1 teaspoon cornstarch. ¼ cup chicken broth. 2 tablespoons vegetable oil for cooking.
Instructions: 1. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce (if using), rice vinegar, sesame oil, cornstarch, and chicken broth. Set aside. 2. Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and stir-fry until cooked through and lightly browned, about 5-7 minutes. Remove chicken from the wok and set aside. 3. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil to the wok. Add minced garlic and grated ginger and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant. 4. Add broccoli florets and red bell pepper. Stir-fry for 3-5 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp. 5. Return chicken to the wok. Give the sauce mixture a quick whisk and pour it over the chicken and vegetables. Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens and coats everything, about 1-2 minutes. 6. Serve immediately, optionally over cooked rice.

Description: A vibrant and flavorful stir-fry featuring tender strips of beef, colorful bell peppers, and onions in a savory garlic-soy sauce.
Ingredients: 1 lb flank steak or sirloin, thinly sliced against the grain. 1 tablespoon cornstarch. 1 tablespoon soy sauce. 1 tablespoon rice wine (Shaoxing or dry sherry). 2 tablespoons vegetable oil. 1 large onion, sliced. 1 red bell pepper, sliced. 1 green bell pepper, sliced. 3 cloves garlic, minced. 1 inch fresh ginger, grated. ¼ cup beef broth. 2 tablespoons soy sauce. 1 tablespoon oyster sauce. 1 teaspoon sugar. 1 teaspoon sesame oil. 1 teaspoon cornstarch.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, toss the thinly sliced beef with 1 tablespoon cornstarch, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, and rice wine. Let marinate for 15 minutes. 2. In a separate small bowl, whisk together all sauce ingredients: beef broth, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, sesame oil, and 1 teaspoon cornstarch. Set aside. 3. Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add marinated beef in a single layer and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until browned. Remove beef from the wok and set aside. 4. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil to the wok. Add sliced onion and bell peppers. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until tender-crisp. 5. Add minced garlic and grated ginger to the vegetables and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant. 6. Return beef to the wok. Give the prepared sauce a quick whisk and pour it over the beef and vegetables. Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens and coats everything, about 1-2 minutes. 7. Serve immediately.

Description: A hearty and flavorful vegetarian stir-fry packed with crispy pan-fried tofu and a colorful array of fresh vegetables in a savory ginger-garlic sauce.
Ingredients: 1 block (14 oz) extra-firm tofu, pressed and cubed. 2 tablespoons cornstarch. 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided. 1 head broccoli, cut into florets. 2 carrots, thinly sliced. 1 red bell pepper, sliced. 1 cup snap peas. 3 cloves garlic, minced. 1 inch fresh ginger, grated. ¼ cup vegetable broth. 3 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce. 1 tablespoon rice vinegar. 1 tablespoon maple syrup or brown sugar. 1 teaspoon sesame oil. 1 teaspoon cornstarch.
Instructions: 1. Press tofu for at least 30 minutes to remove excess water. Cut into 1-inch cubes. In a bowl, toss tofu cubes with 2 tablespoons cornstarch until evenly coated. 2. Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add tofu in a single layer and cook, turning occasionally, until golden brown and crispy on all sides, about 8-10 minutes. Remove tofu from the wok and set aside. 3. In a separate small bowl, whisk together all sauce ingredients: vegetable broth, soy sauce, rice vinegar, maple syrup, sesame oil, and 1 teaspoon cornstarch. Set aside. 4. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil to the wok. Add broccoli florets and sliced carrots. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until slightly tender. 5. Add red bell pepper and snap peas. Stir-fry for another 2 minutes. 6. Add minced garlic and grated ginger to the vegetables and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant. 7. Return crispy tofu to the wok. Give the prepared sauce a quick whisk and pour it over the tofu and vegetables. Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens and coats everything, about 1-2 minutes. 8. Serve immediately.

Description: Traditional Japanese sushi featuring a slice of fresh raw tuna draped over a small mound of seasoned sushi rice.
Ingredients: 2 cups Japanese short-grain sushi rice, uncooked. 2 ½ cups water. ¼ cup rice vinegar. 2 tablespoons sugar. 1 teaspoon salt. 8 ounces sashimi-grade tuna loin. Wasabi paste to taste. Soy sauce for serving. Pickled ginger for serving.
Instructions: 1. Rinse rice under cold water until water runs clear. Drain well. 2. In a medium pot, combine rice and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until water is absorbed. Do not lift lid. 3. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 10 minutes. 4. Transfer hot rice to a large non-metallic bowl. 5. In a small bowl, whisk together rice vinegar, sugar, and salt until sugar and salt dissolve. 6. Pour the vinegar mixture evenly over the rice. Using a rice paddle or wooden spoon, gently fold and cut the rice to incorporate the seasoning, fanning the rice as you mix to cool it quickly. Cover with a damp cloth until ready to use. 7. Slice the tuna loin into 8 uniform pieces, about 2 inches long and ¼ inch thick. 8. Moisten your hands with water. Take about 1 tablespoon of seasoned sushi rice and gently form it into an oval shape. 9. Dab a tiny bit of wasabi onto one side of a tuna slice. 10. Place the tuna slice, wasabi-side down, over the rice mound. Gently press to adhere. 11. Repeat for the remaining pieces. Serve immediately with soy sauce and pickled ginger.

Description: A popular inside-out sushi roll with imitation crab, avocado, and cucumber, often topped with toasted sesame seeds.
Ingredients: 2 cups Japanese short-grain sushi rice, uncooked. 2 ½ cups water. ¼ cup rice vinegar. 2 tablespoons sugar. 1 teaspoon salt. 4 sheets nori seaweed. 8 imitation crab sticks. 1 medium avocado, sliced. 1 small cucumber, julienned. 2 tablespoons toasted white sesame seeds. Soy sauce for serving. Pickled ginger for serving. Wasabi paste for serving.
Instructions: 1. Rinse rice under cold water until water runs clear. Drain well. 2. In a medium pot, combine rice and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until water is absorbed. Do not lift lid. 3. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 10 minutes. 4. Transfer hot rice to a large non-metallic bowl. 5. In a small bowl, whisk together rice vinegar, sugar, and salt until sugar and salt dissolve. 6. Pour the vinegar mixture evenly over the rice. Using a rice paddle or wooden spoon, gently fold and cut the rice to incorporate the seasoning, fanning the rice as you mix to cool it quickly. Cover with a damp cloth until ready to use. 7. Place a bamboo sushi mat on a clean surface. Cover it with plastic wrap. 8. Place one nori sheet shiny-side down on the mat. Moisten your hands and spread about ¾ cup of seasoned sushi rice evenly over the nori, leaving a ½ inch border at the top. 9. Sprinkle sesame seeds over the rice. 10. Carefully flip the nori sheet so the rice side is down on the mat. 11. Arrange 2 imitation crab sticks, a few avocado slices, and some cucumber juliennes horizontally across the center of the nori. 12. Using the mat, carefully roll the sushi tightly, pressing gently as you go. 13. Moisten a sharp knife and slice the roll into 6-8 pieces. 14. Repeat for the remaining ingredients. Serve with soy sauce, pickled ginger, and wasabi.

Description: A flavorful sushi roll filled with fresh salmon mixed in a spicy mayonnaise sauce, often with a hint of sriracha.
Ingredients: 2 cups Japanese short-grain sushi rice, uncooked. 2 ½ cups water. ¼ cup rice vinegar. 2 tablespoons sugar. 1 teaspoon salt. 4 sheets nori seaweed. 8 ounces sashimi-grade salmon. ¼ cup mayonnaise. 1-2 tablespoons sriracha sauce (to taste). 1 teaspoon sesame oil. 2 green onions, thinly sliced. Soy sauce for serving. Pickled ginger for serving. Wasabi paste for serving.
Instructions: 1. Rinse rice under cold water until water runs clear. Drain well. 2. In a medium pot, combine rice and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until water is absorbed. Do not lift lid. 3. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 10 minutes. 4. Transfer hot rice to a large non-metallic bowl. 5. In a small bowl, whisk together rice vinegar, sugar, and salt until sugar and salt dissolve. 6. Pour the vinegar mixture evenly over the rice. Using a rice paddle or wooden spoon, gently fold and cut the rice to incorporate the seasoning, fanning the rice as you mix to cool it quickly. Cover with a damp cloth until ready to use. 7. Dice the sashimi-grade salmon into small, ¼-inch cubes. 8. In a medium bowl, combine the diced salmon, mayonnaise, sriracha, sesame oil, and sliced green onions. Mix well. 9. Place a bamboo sushi mat on a clean surface. Cover it with plastic wrap. 10. Place one nori sheet shiny-side down on the mat. Moisten your hands and spread about ¾ cup of seasoned sushi rice evenly over the nori, leaving a ½ inch border at the top. 11. Arrange about ¼ of the spicy salmon mixture horizontally across the center of the rice. 12. Using the mat, carefully roll the sushi tightly, pressing gently as you go. 13. Moisten a sharp knife and slice the roll into 6-8 pieces. 14. Repeat for the remaining ingredients. Serve with soy sauce, pickled ginger, and wasabi.

Description: A refreshing and healthy vegan sushi roll featuring crisp cucumber and creamy avocado, perfect for a light meal.
Ingredients: 2 cups Japanese short-grain sushi rice, uncooked. 2 ½ cups water. ¼ cup rice vinegar. 2 tablespoons sugar. 1 teaspoon salt. 4 sheets nori seaweed. 1 large cucumber, peeled and julienned. 1 large avocado, sliced. 2 tablespoons toasted black sesame seeds (optional). Soy sauce for serving. Pickled ginger for serving. Wasabi paste for serving.
Instructions: 1. Rinse rice under cold water until water runs clear. Drain well. 2. In a medium pot, combine rice and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until water is absorbed. Do not lift lid. 3. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 10 minutes. 4. Transfer hot rice to a large non-metallic bowl. 5. In a small bowl, whisk together rice vinegar, sugar, and salt until sugar and salt dissolve. 6. Pour the vinegar mixture evenly over the rice. Using a rice paddle or wooden spoon, gently fold and cut the rice to incorporate the seasoning, fanning the rice as you mix to cool it quickly. Cover with a damp cloth until ready to use. 7. Place a bamboo sushi mat on a clean surface. Cover it with plastic wrap. 8. Place one nori sheet shiny-side down on the mat. Moisten your hands and spread about ¾ cup of seasoned sushi rice evenly over the nori, leaving a ½ inch border at the top. 9. Sprinkle black sesame seeds over the rice if desired. 10. Arrange a portion of julienned cucumber and avocado slices horizontally across the center of the rice. 11. Using the mat, carefully roll the sushi tightly, pressing gently as you go. 12. Moisten a sharp knife and slice the roll into 6-8 pieces. 13. Repeat for the remaining ingredients. Serve with soy sauce, pickled ginger, and wasabi.

Description: A popular sushi roll featuring crispy fried shrimp tempura, often combined with avocado and a drizzle of spicy mayo or eel sauce.
Ingredients: 2 cups Japanese short-grain sushi rice, uncooked. 2 ½ cups water. ¼ cup rice vinegar. 2 tablespoons sugar. 1 teaspoon salt. 4 sheets nori seaweed. 12 large shrimp, peeled and deveined, tails on. 1 cup tempura batter mix. 1 cup ice-cold water. Oil for deep frying. 1 large avocado, sliced. Spicy mayonnaise or eel sauce for drizzling (optional). Soy sauce for serving. Pickled ginger for serving. Wasabi paste for serving.
Instructions: 1. Rinse rice under cold water until water runs clear. Drain well. 2. In a medium pot, combine rice and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until water is absorbed. Do not lift lid. 3. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 10 minutes. 4. Transfer hot rice to a large non-metallic bowl. 5. In a small bowl, whisk together rice vinegar, sugar, and salt until sugar and salt dissolve. 6. Pour the vinegar mixture evenly over the rice. Using a rice paddle or wooden spoon, gently fold and cut the rice to incorporate the seasoning, fanning the rice as you mix to cool it quickly. Cover with a damp cloth until ready to use. 7. Prepare the shrimp tempura: In a bowl, whisk tempura batter mix with ice-cold water until just combined (do not overmix, lumps are fine). 8. Heat oil in a deep pot to 350°F (175°C). 9. Dip each shrimp into the batter, letting excess drip off. Fry in hot oil for 2-3 minutes until golden brown and crispy. Drain on a wire rack. 10. Place a bamboo sushi mat on a clean surface. Cover it with plastic wrap. 11. Place one nori sheet shiny-side down on the mat. Moisten your hands and spread about ¾ cup of seasoned sushi rice evenly over the nori, leaving a ½ inch border at the top. 12. Carefully flip the nori sheet so the rice side is down on the mat. 13. Arrange 3 tempura shrimp and a few avocado slices horizontally across the center of the nori. 14. Using the mat, carefully roll the sushi tightly, pressing gently as you go. 15. Moisten a sharp knife and slice the roll into 6-8 pieces. 16. Repeat for the remaining ingredients. Drizzle with spicy mayonnaise or eel sauce if desired. Serve with soy sauce, pickled ginger, and wasabi.

Description: Savory ground beef seasoned to perfection, served in warm tortillas with your favorite fresh toppings.
Ingredients: 1 lb ground beef. 1 packet taco seasoning (or homemade: 1 tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp paprika, ½ tsp garlic powder, ½ tsp onion powder, ¼ tsp cayenne pepper, salt and pepper to taste). ½ cup water. 12 corn or flour tortillas. Toppings: shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, sour cream, salsa.
Instructions: 1. Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat, breaking it apart with a spoon. Drain any excess fat. 2. Stir in taco seasoning and water. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until most of the liquid has evaporated and the beef is well-coated. 3. Warm tortillas according to package directions (microwave, oven, or skillet). 4. Fill each warm tortilla with seasoned beef and desired toppings. Serve immediately.

Recipe Name: Spicy Shrimp Tacos with Cilantro Lime Slaw
Description: Zesty and spicy shrimp nestled in warm tortillas, topped with a refreshing cilantro-lime cabbage slaw.
Ingredients: 1 lb raw shrimp, peeled and deveined. 1 tbsp olive oil. 1 tsp chili powder. ½ tsp smoked paprika. ¼ tsp cayenne pepper (optional). Salt and pepper to taste. 12 small corn or flour tortillas. For the slaw: 2 cups shredded cabbage. ¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro. 2 tbsp lime juice. 1 tbsp olive oil. Salt and pepper to taste. For the sauce: ¼ cup Greek yogurt or sour cream. 1 tbsp lime juice. 1 tsp hot sauce (optional).
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, toss shrimp with 1 tbsp olive oil, chili powder, smoked paprika, cayenne (if using), salt, and pepper. 2. For the slaw, combine shredded cabbage, cilantro, 2 tbsp lime juice, 1 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper in a separate bowl. Toss to combine and set aside. 3. For the sauce, whisk together Greek yogurt/sour cream, 1 tbsp lime juice, and hot sauce (if using). 4. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add seasoned shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until pink and opaque. 5. Warm tortillas. 6. Assemble tacos: place shrimp in tortillas, top with cilantro-lime slaw, and drizzle with the creamy sauce.

Description: A flavorful vegetarian taco option featuring seasoned black beans, sweet corn, and a vibrant fresh salsa.
Ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil. 1 small onion, diced. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 (15-ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained. 1 cup frozen corn, thawed. 1 tsp chili powder. ½ tsp cumin. ¼ tsp smoked paprika. Salt and pepper to taste. 12 small corn or flour tortillas. For the salsa: 1 cup diced tomatoes. ¼ cup red onion, finely chopped. ¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro. 1 tbsp lime juice.
Instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more until fragrant. 2. Stir in black beans, corn, chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until heated through and flavors meld. 3. While beans are cooking, prepare the salsa: combine diced tomatoes, red onion, cilantro, and lime juice in a small bowl. 4. Warm tortillas. 5. Fill each warm tortilla with the black bean and corn mixture, then top with fresh salsa.

Description: Shredded chicken simmered in a smoky, spicy chipotle tomato sauce, perfect for a hearty and flavorful taco night.
Ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 1 lb). 1 tbsp olive oil. 1 medium onion, thinly sliced. 2 cloves garlic, minced. 1 (14.5-ounce) can diced tomatoes, undrained. 2-3 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, minced (adjust to spice preference). 1 tbsp adobo sauce from the can. ½ cup chicken broth. ½ tsp cumin. Salt and pepper to taste. 12 small corn or flour tortillas. Toppings: crumbled cotija cheese, sliced avocado, chopped cilantro, lime wedges.
Instructions: 1. Poach chicken breasts in simmering water or broth until cooked through (about 15-20 minutes). Shred chicken using two forks and set aside. 2. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add sliced onion and cook until softened and lightly caramelized, about 8-10 minutes. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute more. 3. Stir in diced tomatoes (undrained), minced chipotle peppers, adobo sauce, chicken broth, cumin, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes, allowing flavors to meld and sauce to thicken slightly. 4. Add shredded chicken to the sauce and stir to coat. Simmer for another 5 minutes to heat through. 5. Warm tortillas. 6. Fill each warm tortilla with chicken tinga, then top with cotija cheese, avocado, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime juice.

Description: A delicious and satisfying way to start your day, packed with scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, and melted cheese in a warm tortilla.
Ingredients: 6 large eggs. 2 tbsp milk (optional). Salt and pepper to taste. 4 slices bacon, cooked and crumbled (or 4 oz breakfast sausage, cooked). ½ cup shredded cheddar cheese. 6 small corn or flour tortillas. Optional toppings: salsa, avocado slices, hot sauce.
Instructions: 1. In a bowl, whisk eggs with milk (if using), salt, and pepper until well combined. 2. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Pour in egg mixture and scramble until cooked to your desired consistency. 3. Warm tortillas. 4. Lay out warm tortillas. Divide scrambled eggs, crumbled bacon (or sausage), and shredded cheese among them. 5. Fold or roll up the tacos. Add optional toppings like salsa, avocado, or hot sauce. Serve immediately.
